case_title: The State vs. Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Others

accussed_details.name: Bushra Imran
accussed_details.designation: Trustee of Al-Qadir University Project Trust
allegation: Aiding and abetting misuse of authority

complaint_summary: Allegations of corruption and misuse of authority by Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Bushra Imran involving illegal diversion of Â£190 million frozen by the UK's National Crime Agency, benefiting Malik Riaz Hussain and the Al-Qadir University Project Trust.
investigation_summary: NAB initiated an inquiry in July 2022, upgraded to investigation in April 2023. Evidence included financial records, trust deeds, Cabinet meeting minutes, and witness testimonies corroborating misuse of authority and illegal gratification.
judgment_summary: Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi convicted under Sections 9(a)(ii), (iv), (vi), and (xii) of the NAO, 1999; sentenced to 14 years rigorous imprisonment and fined Rs. 1 million. Bushra Imran convicted under Section 9(a)(xii) of the NAO, 1999; sentenced to 7 years rigorous imprisonment and fined Rs. 500,000. Al-Qadir University Project Trust assets forfeited to the Federal Government.
punishment: Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi: 14 years rigorous imprisonment, Rs. 1 million fine. Bushra Imran: 7 years rigorous imprisonment, Rs. 500,000 fine. Forfeiture of Al-Qadir University Project Trust assets.
Decision_or_verdict: Conviction of Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Bushra Imran for corruption and misuse of authority.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued misuse of authority and illegal gratification.
Defense claimed political victimization and good faith actions.

witness_statement.Cabinet members: Confirmed violations of Rules of Business, 1973 and lack of consultation.
witness_statement.NAB officials: Provided evidence of financial transactions and trust deeds.
witness_statement.Other witnesses: Corroborated allegations of misuse of authority and illegal gratification.

key_issues: Conflict of interest in trust establishment

legal_terms.Misuse of authority: Improper use of official position for personal or private benefit.
legal_terms.Quid pro quo: Exchange of favors or benefits for mutual advantage.

words_and_phrases.Illegal gratification: Receiving benefits in exchange for unlawful actions.
words_and_phrases.Conflict of interest: Situation where personal interests interfere with official duties.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves allegations of corruption and misuse of authority by Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Bushra Imran, focusing on illegal diversion of funds and personal benefits derived from the Al-Qadir University Project Trust.
